definition: lit. dragon soaring and tiger leaping (idiom)/fig. prosperous and bustling/vigorous and active
dragon/CL:條|条[tiao2]/imperial
surname Long
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
to jump/to leap

sentences.english: Today, this piece of land of has long been turned upside down, hustle and bustle.
sentences.chinese: 如今，这片热土早已是天翻地覆，龙腾虎跃。

sentences.english: Western people are dreaming now of tigers and dragons.
sentences.chinese: 西方人梦到了龙腾虎跃。

definition: old but still full of vitality (idiom)
lit. where tigers crouch and dragons coil (idiom); fig. forbidding terrain
to start practicing at the first crow of the cock (idiom)/to be diligent in one's studies
lit. the giant Peng bird spreads its wings and begins to fly/displaying awesome power and momentum at the outset/to have the world at one's feet
the fabled roc flies ten thousand miles (idiom)/one's future prospects are brilliant
spirit reaches to the rainbow/full of noble aspiration and daring
the dragon and phoenix are symbols of good fortune (idiom)/auspicious/decorated with auspicious symbols such as the dragon and the phoenix
long-lived people, rich harvests (idiom); stable and affluent society/prosperity
lit. coiled dragon, crouching tiger (idiom)/fig. talented individuals in hiding/concealed talent
to win instant success (idiom)
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
(idiom) dauntless/courageous/spirited
lit. the dragon wars, the tiger battles (idiom); fierce battle between giants
(in the spring) nature takes on a new look (idiom)
lit. lovely flowers, round moon (idiom); fig. everything is wonderful/perfect happiness/conjugal bliss
the warbler sings and the swallow dances/prosperity abounds (idiom)
